definition: a powerful chief of the princes of the Spring and Autumn Period (770-476 BC)/overlord/hegemon
hegemon/tyrant/lord/feudal chief/to rule by force/to usurp/(in modern advertising) master
owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)

sentences.english: Oslash; Starscream, Overlord, Scorponok and Onslaught agree to follow Megatron.
sentences.chinese: 红蜘蛛，霸主，萨克巨人与袭击同谋共保威震天。

sentences.english: Anor hoped to strike back at Overlord Shimrra in revenge for his misfortune.
sentences.chinese: 阿诺希望对希姆拉霸主发动反击，为自己的不幸报仇。

sentences.english: There are plenty of reasons to doubt the dollar's dethronement.
sentences.chinese: 有大量的理由让人怀疑美元会失去霸主地位。

sentences.english: Later overlords were mostly derived from these great states.
sentences.chinese: 后来霸主大多来自这些伟大的国家。

sentences.english: The Chinese men dominated on their home soil, as expected.
sentences.chinese: 中国男子体操队不负众望在本土取得霸主地位。

sentences.english: We need to do this before China becomes a hegemon
sentences.chinese: 我们需要在中国成为霸主之前做这件事。

sentences.english: Creative slogans throughout the years have kept Coca-Cola "king of hill."
sentences.chinese: 历年充满创意的口号使可口可乐一直保持霸主地位。

sentences.english: American universities took all 5 top places and have 72 entries in the top 200.
sentences.chinese: 美国一共有72所高校入围200强，彰显霸主地位。

sentences.english: That early cultivation has ensured diving supremacy for the People's Republic.
sentences.chinese: 早期培养为人民共和国确保了跳水的霸主地位。

sentences.english: Hence superpowerdom is Beijing's for the taking, in this decade or the next.
sentences.chinese: 因此这个十年，或下个十年，中国必是世界的霸主。

sentences.english: This is what economic hegemony will look like.
sentences.chinese: 这才是经济霸主应有的规模。

sentences.english: TOYOTA becomes the new dominator in global automobile industry as impetuous development.
sentences.chinese: 丰田正以凶猛的声势成为全球汽车业新一轮的霸主。

sentences.english: In the 1980’s, Japan seemed to be becoming the new economic hegemon.
sentences.chinese: 在1980年代，日本好像变成了一个新的经济霸主。

sentences.english: Is your immediate plan to emulate Sir Alex with Molde and transform the club into a dominant force in Norway?
sentences.chinese: 你打算学习爵爷好榜样，让莫尔德也成为挪威霸主吗？

sentences.english: China plans to take over from Britain in ruling the Olympic waves.
sentences.chinese: 中国打算接替英国成为海上霸主弄潮新秀。

sentences.english: The males fight for the title of dominant beach master.
sentences.chinese: 公象海豹争夺海滩霸主的头衔。

definition: lit. to proclaim oneself hegemon/to take a leading role/to build a personal fiefdom
to contend for hegemony/a power struggle
old, well-known brand/old style/old school/an old hand/experienced veteran
to aspire to the throne/to aim at (the first place etc)
great heroes pursue deer in the central plains (idiom); fig. many vie for supremacy
